newsitem.title: PERU: Peru central bank declares 42-day CD auction void.
newsitem.headline: Peru central bank declares 42-day CD auction void.

text.p: The Central Reserve Bank of Peru said it declared void Tuesday's auction BCQZ of 20.0 million soles of 42-day Certificates of Deposit (CDs).
The central bank gave no reason for its decision.
At the last CD auction on October 15, 30.0 million soles worth of 42-day CDs drew an average yield of 14.05 percent.
The average effective annual interest rate for the certificates is used as an informal indicator for interest rates in the Peruvian financial system.
